name: Make and Take Crafternoon Fundraiser
description:
For many of us, sharing food is central to our holiday celebrations.

We invite you to help us support Second Harvest in their efforts to bring food to those in need. Spend a creative afternoon of craft activities using beautiful papers from our collection.

There will be a choice of activity stations ranging from origami to cardmaking to ornaments to decorations. Choose to make one item, two items, or make them all!

The vision of Second Harvest is no waste, no hunger. They seek out surplus, edible food that businesses can't use and through a food recovery network, get it to the people in our communities who need it.

Thank you! We look forward to creating with you! All skill levels welcome.

name: We Care 2025
description:
Join us for fun afternoon of holiday arts and crafts! 

Children will leave with a big smile and a bag full of handcrafted gifts made by themselves to hang on the Christmas tree, play with, or gift to their loved ones. Last year alone, 250 families and their caregivers attended. 

Perfect for children between ages 3-12. Snacks and treats included!

name: Drag Masterclass Showcase: Class of 2025
description:
Get ready for the most electric night of the year!

We're proudly presenting our fierce collective of emerging Drag artists who have trained with some of the biggest names in the industry during our 10-week Drag Masterclass Program session this Fall. 

Hosted by our lead instructor and incomparable show host Queen Paris Matik, this evening of Drag excellence highlights months of training, creativity, resilience, and pure passion.

Drag Masterclass is a free 10-week program empowers 2SLGBTQIA+ youth ages 13 to 24 through workshops on Drag performance, social media marketing, make-up, costume design, and more. Participants worked with accomplished mentors including Paris Matik, Virgo Queen and designer Suki Doll.

name: Earth Angels at DROM Taberna
description:
Toronto babes, lace up your platforms and charge your crystals because we're taking over Drom Taberna for a night of unhinged sexy techno, queer chaos and anthems! We have three incredible DJs serving beats that will make your soul ascend and your booty do things it's never done before:

DJ PHILLIPPE @djphillippe

SOPHIE JONES @sophiejones

THIRDEYE @thirdeye.wav

name: Rewind with Tynomi Banks: Dinner and Drag Experience
description:
Serving feel-good energy, great music, and a healthy dose of nostalgia. 

Known for her ability to pick the perfect track to get you moving in your seat, Tynomi takes you through the best hits of the '80s, '90s, and 2000s for an unforgettable night of entertainment and delicious dining.

name: Christmas Carol Sing-A-Long
description:
Join us for a joy-filled carol sing-along to welcome the holiday season.

No talent required. This is not karaoke, or one of those 4-part harmony choirs, we're just going to gather in our favourite haunt, enjoy a beverage or two, and sing along to some of our favourite Christmas songs, both traditional and contemporary.

Lyrics will be provided.

Ugly Christmas sweaters or holiday outfits encouraged.

name: Punk in Toronto: A Panel Discussion
description:
Inspired by Tracey Snelling's counter-culture aesthetics in INTERGALACTIC PLANETARY, Koffler Arts welcomes prominent figures of the Canadian punk and grunge movements, to examine the origin of these subcultures in Toronto, and the strong legacy they left to the underground scene. 

Moderated by curator, writer, and artist David Liss, this lively panel discussion will feature panelists including: Liz Worth, novelist, poet and author of Treat Me Like Dirt: An Oral History of Punk in Toronto and Beyond, Gary Topp, legendary music promoter and author of He Hijacked My Brain and Ian MacKay, visual artist and co-founder of the punk rock band The Diodes and the musical performance space The Crash n' Burn.

The panel will include questions from the audience.

name: The Grink Talk Show
description:
Expect chaos from Toronto's most festive fools. Hosted by the Grink.

Featuring sketches by Nkasi Ogbonnah and Summer Dad, improvised musical by Staccayto Staccato, imrpove from Rush Hour 4 the Holidays and Maybe Jon Blair.

name: Joseph Landau live at DROM Taberna
description: Joseph Landau is a multi-instrumentalist recording artist, singer, teacher and performer. He has his grade 8 in classical guitar from the Royal Conservatory of Music as well as a B.F.A. in music from York University, where he studied performance, composition, and improvisation. These days Joseph mainly performs as an accordionist, songwriter, and singer of English, French, Yiddish, Hebrew, German and Italian songs.
